thread.title: Missouri hoping pomp and circumstance of Homecoming will help on Saturday
thread.title_full: Missouri hoping pomp and circumstance of Homecoming will help on Saturday

title: Missouri hoping pomp and circumstance of Homecoming will help on Saturday
text:
Missouri hoping pomp and circumstance of Homecoming will help on Saturday Kim Klement / USA TODAY Sports Oct 8, 2015 at 10:50p ET 0Shares 
Homecoming weekend is a special time for all involved. Pinkel on homecoming against Florida: “We didn’t have a night game at our stadium last year, so we’re excited about that." — Tod Palmer (@todpalmer) October 7, 2015 
Former students, faculty, and fans of the program come out in droves for the celebratory event. There's often a tangible buzz surrounding the day, which enhances the gameday feel even further than usual. In Missouri 's case, its Homecoming weekend takes place this Saturday, as it hosts No. 11 Florida at 7:30 p.m. ET. Pinkel on home night games: "The night atmosphere, our students they feel it and are part of it." — Dave Matter (@Dave_Matter) October 7, 2015 
The time of the contest is noteworthy, considering Missouri did not have a home game at night last year. The Tigers will need a bit of extra juice in order to pull off the upset in this contest. Florida's talented defense surely will look to disrupt true freshman quarterback Drew Lock with an amalgam of exotic blitz packages and speed off of the edge. Who's ready for a @MU_Homecoming night game in #TheZOU ?! pic.twitter.com/d3DOIuEwaN — Mizzou Football (@MizzouFootball) October 8, 2015 
Can the Missouri faithful give Gary Pinkel's squad the extra boost it needs on Homecoming weekend? 
Stay tuned for Saturday. MORE NEWS: Want stories delivered to you? Sign up for our College Football newsletters. 0
